name: mangaknightz
text: gosh teodor gets sassy

name: tellumo
text: But Ray deserves it. He probably thought about employing a little Panama boy to vacuum the dropped gerunds out the bottom of [i]his[i] Escalade a minute later.

name: tellumo
text: A comment left by tellumo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by NotGodot, sevenarts, riotnrrd, oto)

name: twohundredninety
text:
I COMPLETELY AGREE

But I can think of a rationale, sort of: If they use BBcode, they can categorically deactivate everything in angle brackets, making it really easy to prevent screwy script injection exploits and blah blah blah.

But this isn't a very good reason, I think. It would be only marginally more difficult to allow the obvious tags like and and disallow DHTML and other things likely to fuck with their shit. And, anyway, it seems like they could just leave their HTML-donker intact and parse and tags themselves in exactly the same way they're handling BBcode now.

It would be pretty great if they did this, I think, and allowed, in addition to the current BBcode tags, equivalent HTML tags. Any assetbar dudes watching?

name: twohundredninety
text: I use "dudes" in the gender-neutral sense, of course. No tacit support here for the stereotype of computery-type people being male.

name: tellumo
text:
Exactly. Allow A, B, I, U, STRIKE, and IMG and you've got basically everything you need. Add filtering for too-wide elements and you're done.

Then again, I've been waiting for LiveJournal to add an HTML-aware spellchecker for about four years now, so maybe we'll have to wait a bit . . . :-(

name: professorhazard
text: The fact of the matter is, however, that whether it was BBCode tags or HTML tags, you left out the slash in the closer. That is neither machine language's fault. Only yours.

name: w_t_f
text: How about you read the help section? When in doubt, read the instructions.

name: pogo
text: A comment left by pogo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, riotdejaneiro, sevenarts)

name: slickshoes3234
text: we could use HTML and be respective disgraces to our families

name: rowboat
text: OK! Enough with the nerdistry, already. I need an English major. My question is this - are the gerunds referred to in this strip of the linguistic variety? If so, please help me to understand the joke. If not, what are gerunds? Please help. I love this strip so much as it is, but feel as though I'm missing something.

name: eatmorekix
text:
dropping the gerund: "going" becomes "goin'", "fucking" becomes "fuckin'", etc.

i could be wrong. i am no queen of grammar but this is just my assumption.

name: rowboat
text: I trust that you are correct and I thank you.

name: bjorntd
text: Dropped gerunds are typical in Ebonics, which Teodor is mocking here. A dropped gerund is a gerund (words like running jumping etc) minus the "ing" suffix, so, for example, "I've got to tip the Panamanian boy who is vacuuming the gerunds from the Escalade's carpet" becomes "I got to tip the little Panama boy what vacuums my dropped gerunds out of the bottom of my Escalade."

name: rowboat
text: Thank you. Thank you all.

name: i_love_kate
text: Oh, yes. I thought he was just using "gerund" as some kind of weird slang for cigarette ends. I'm both relieved and amused!

name: tasteful
text: and pretty dumb to think that

name: heccibiggs
text: Oh my God you just made this strip even better.

name: ananke
text: Haha, thanks for pointing that out.  I totally missed that because the text has become so small in the last few strips.

name: ananke
text: um, that was funny haha, not sarcastic haha, just to clarify there.

name: belgand
text: True, but if you screwed up in the same fashion in HTML it wouldn't be any different. Face it man, you straight-up dropped a / in there. Own up to it and be a man .

He was born in the US but his parents were British. Hmm, now that I think of it, Kelsey Grammer could be pretty good too.

Ok, wait, stick with me people,

Christopher Walken as Lie Bot?

I'm gonna get lamed so hard, but come on guys, Achewood the animated series needs Walken somewhere. Maybe Beef? Beef's weird way of talking might be served well by Walken. Maybe Emeril?

name: overmedicated
text: I ALWAYS placed Walken as Roast Beef. Seriously, the weird speech patterns could be done to a tee.

text: I agree.  I never really placed the two together until now, but it make perfect sense.

text: Disagree.  Beef's speech isn't in weird patterns, it is just understated and low.  Who in Hollywood does understated and low?  William H Macey or perhaps Steve Buschemi come to mind, but neither is perfect.

name: nessotron
text:
Just to elaborate on this, it's implied Cornelius was born in Cambridge, as that's where he first lived. Whether that's in Cambridge, MA or the famous English university town, I'd assume the latter.

Roxx Street in cambridge!

name: choosebro
text: I also believe that Stephen Fry is a Cambridge man, English Literature. It is the perfect match!

name: spinynorman
text: I don't have much to say, I'm just showing up.

name: choosebro
text: Fry! Everyone should love Stephen Fry.

name: rowboat
text:
As uncomfortable as I have always been with the thought of an animated Achewood ( those types of things never turn out right ), this is a fun game and, in spite of myself, I've definitely spent some time thinking about it. One or two of these ideas were mentioned by others at various points - if I could remember who said what I'd credit them. Here are the possibilities that I (and they) have considered:

Beef - Crispin Glover

Cornelius - Michael Gambon (Please everybody, stop this Kelsey Grammer nonsense. The man's got no class.)

Teodor - Adrien Brody (I understand that Teodor's Belarusian and Brody isn't, but I know a few people of Russian decent who've lived in the states their entire life and who, unlike their parents, speak perfect American English, so this doesn't feel far-fetched to me).

Molly - Lucy Davis

Ray - Andre Benjamin

Lyle - Benicio Del Toro (I realize that Lyle isn't Hispanic, but I think Del Toro could bring a lot of life to the part. Think Fear and Loathing.)

Philippe - An actual child. By "actual," I guess I mean "not necessarily an actor." Think Charlie Brown Christmas. Like that.

Pat - David Hyde Pierce

Lie Bot - Christopher Walken ( perfect! thank you, riazm)

Again, let me stress that I do not wish for this to happen. But if it had to, this would be pretty ideal.

name: spinynorman
text: David Hyde Pearce, while gay, is not aggressive. He may radiate finicky pickiness, but not the kind you want to drive a car into, then get out of the driver's side and walk around and pummel mercilessly in the face.

name: rowboat
text: Yes, yes. But he's an actor. He could make it happen.

name: history
text: Agreed.  Pat has anger problems, and that isn't David Hyde Pearce...might be Jon Malkovich though.

name: dtuba
text: Adrian Brody is an inspired choice. For Ray, might I suggest Big Boi instead of Andre Benjamin? Or maybe (beating dead horse here) Craig Robinson from The (American) Office .

name: rowboat
text: You know, some people around here used to say that Tracy Morgan would be a better choice for Ray and I always used to disagree. But since then I have embarked on many 30 Rock binges and I now agree wholeheartedly. Beyond that, I don't think I'd make any changes to the above list.

name: dtuba
text:
I would be entirely satisfied with this.
Tracy Morgan is one funny motherfucker.

name: dtuba
text:
Not sure about Crispin Glover. The man is too weird . Many people have suggested Joseph Gordon-Levitt for the voice of Beef. {/endorse]
Anyway, this is a fun game. I could do this all day.

name: riazm
text:
Tuff Gong is a record label that was formed by the reggae group The Wailers in 1970 and named after Bob Marley's nickname. The first single on the label was "Run For Cover" by The Wailers. The Tuff Gong headquarters were located at 56 Hope Road, in Kingston, Jamaica, Bob Marley's home. The location is now home to the Bob Marley Museum.

Thank you Wikipedia, for knowing everything that anyone could possibly ever need to know.

text: I'm calling bullshit on Ray's reason for getting a letter-folding machine. I'm pretty sure he just stuck a page of a Sky Mall magazine to a dartboard, and bought whatever he hit.

name: spinynorman
text: I find the letter-writing process very stressful and often confusing. If I'm mailing something extremely important then sometimes I put the return address on the wrong side of the stamp on the wrong side. One time I mailed a completely empty letter because I was so concerned with the envelope turning out looking nice I forgot that they usually are supposed to hold things, namely letters.

name: tekende
text: The recipient must have been hell of confused.

name: spinynorman
text:
My grandma was so mad her shouts could have been heard all around the county.

But, well, that's part for the course, for her.

...she is such an angry woman.

name: heccibiggs
text:
That reminds me of the time I tried to make hot chocolate in the microwave, but in my haste forgot to put in the milk or powder.

Basically, I wasted three minutes, and God knows how much energy, heating up a mug.
